titleStmt.title: William A. Mohon et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4911

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Muhlenburg County Ky May 21st 1864
Governor Bramlet Dear Sir

The Muhlenburg circuit Court has fixed a fine upon James H. Craig: at the present May term on the 12th day of Said month it being the 4th day of the term for $50. for improper conduct towards a Married lady; now Sir the charge and the evidence befor the court was simply as follows Viz: that Said Craig Should have rode up to the fince and called for Mustar Seeds the Lady taken them to h him and he shuck hands with her and held to her hand rather longer than She thought he Should have done and perhapse Said com up here: and Sir that was all of it:
Now Sir we are personaly acquainted with Said Craig and believe him to be a high toned gentlema: of good moral Standing: and a prominent member in Society.
We therefore pray you remite the above named fine yours Etc
